remarks: A non-zero functional has a value of 1 at some argument belonging to the orthocomplement of its kernel (when its kernel is a closed hyperplane). Tighter version of ~ lfl1 .  (Contributed by NM, 2-Jan-2015.)
statement:
dochkr1.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
dochkr1.o $e |- ._|_ = ( ( ocH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dochkr1.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dochkr1.v $e |- V = ( Base ` U ) $.
dochkr1.r $e |- R = ( Scalar ` U ) $.
dochkr1.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` U ) $.
dochkr1.i $e |- .1. = ( 1r ` R ) $.
dochkr1.f $e |- F = ( LFnl ` U ) $.
dochkr1.l $e |- L = ( LKer ` U ) $.
dochkr1.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
dochkr1.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. F ) $.
dochkr1.n $e |- ( ph -> ( ._|_ ` ( ._|_ ` ( L ` G ) ) ) =/= V ) $.
dochkr1 $p |- ( ph -> E. x e. ( ( ._|_ ` ( L ` G ) ) \ { .0. } ) ( G ` x ) = .1. ) $.
$d .0. x $.
$d .1. x $.
$d ._|_ x $.
$d G x $.
$d L x $.
$d R x $.
$d U x $.
